verses.verse: Hear <WH8085> ye this<WH1004>, O house of Jacob<WH3290>, who are called<WH7121> by the name<WH8034> of Israel<WH3478>, and are come forth<WH3318> out of the waters<WH4325> of Judah<WH3063>; who swear<WH7650> by the name<WH8034> of Jehovah<WH3068>, and make mention<WH2142> of the God<WH430> of Israel<WH3478>, but not in truth<WH571>, nor in righteousness<WH6666>
(for they call<WH7121> themselves of the holy<WH6944> city<WH5892>, and stay<WH5564> themselves upon the God<WH430> of Israel<WH3478>; Jehovah<WH3068> of hosts<WH6635> is his name<WH8034>):

I have declared<WH5046> the former things<WH7223> from of old<WH227>; yea<WH3318>, they went forth out of my mouth<WH6310>, and I showed<WH8085> them<WH6597>: suddenly I did<WH6213> them<WH935>, and they came to pass.
Because I knew<WH1847> that thou art obstinate<WH7186>, and thy neck<WH6203> is an iron<WH1270> sinew<WH1517>, and thy brow<WH4696> brass<WH5154>;

therefore I have declared<WH5046> it to thee from of old<WH227>; before it came to pass<WH935> I showed<WH8085> it thee<WH559>; lest thou shouldest say, Mine idol<WH6090> hath done<WH6213> them<WH6459>, and my graven image, and my molten image<WH5262>, hath commanded them<WH6680>.

Thou hast heard<WH8085> it<WH2372>; behold all this<WH5046>; and ye, will ye not declare it<WH8085>? I have showed thee new things<WH2319> from this time<WH6258>, even hidden things<WH5341>, which thou hast not known<WH3045>.
They are created<WH1254> now<WH6440>, and not from of old; and before this day<WH3117> thou heardest<WH8085> them not<WH559>; lest thou shouldest say, Behold<WH3045>, I knew them.

Yea <WH8085>, thou heardest not<WH3045>; yea, thou knewest not<WH241>; yea, from of old thine ear was not opened<WH6605>: for I knew<WH3045> that thou didst deal very<WH898> treacherously<WH898>, and wast called<WH7121> a transgressor<WH6586> from the womb<WH990>.
For my name<WH8034>'s sake will I defer<WH748> mine anger<WH639>, and for my praise<WH8416> will I refrain<WH2413> for thee<WH3772>, that I cut thee not off.
Behold <WH6884>, I have refined thee<WH3701>, but not as silver; I have chosen<WH977> thee in the furnace<WH3564> of affliction<WH6040>.
For mine own sake<WH6213>, for mine own sake, will I do it<WH2490>; for how should my name be profaned? and my glory<WH3519> will I not give<WH5414> to another<WH312>.
Hearken <WH8085> unto me<WH3290>, O Jacob, and Israel<WH3478> my called<WH7121>: I am he<WH7223>; I am the first, I also am the last<WH314>.

Yea <WH3027>, my hand hath laid the foundation<WH3245> of the earth<WH776>, and my right hand<WH3225> hath spread<WH2946> out the heavens<WH8064>: when I call<WH7121> unto them<WH5975>, they stand up together<WH3162>.

Assemble <WH6908> yourselves<WH8085>, all ye, and hear; who among them hath declared<WH5046> these things<WH3068>? He whom Jehovah loveth<WH157> shall perform<WH6213> his pleasure<WH2656> on Babylon<WH894>, and his arm<WH2220> shall be on the Chaldeans<WH3778>.
I <WH1696>, even I, have spoken; yea<WH7121>, I have called him<WH935>; I have brought him<WH1870>, and he shall make his way prosperous<WH6743>.

Come <WH7126> ye near<WH7126> unto me<WH8085>, hear ye this<WH7218>; from the beginning I have not spoken<WH1696> in secret<WH5643>; from the time<WH6256> that it was<WH136>, there am I: and now the Lord Jehovah<WH3069> hath sent<WH7971> me<WH7307>, and his Spirit.

Thus saith<WH559> Jehovah<WH3068>, thy Redeemer<WH1350>, the Holy One<WH6918> of Israel<WH3478>: I am Jehovah<WH3068> thy God<WH430>, who teacheth<WH3925> thee to profit<WH3276>, who leadeth<WH1869> thee by the way<WH1870> that thou shouldest go<WH3212>.
Oh that<WH3863> thou hadst hearkened<WH7181> to my commandments<WH4687>! then had thy peace<WH7965> been as a river<WH5104>, and thy righteousness<WH6666> as the waves<WH1530> of the sea<WH3220>:

thy seed<WH2233> also had been as the sand<WH2344>, and the offspring<WH6631> of thy bowels<WH4578> like the grains<WH4579> thereof<WH8034>: his name would not be cut off<WH3772> nor destroyed<WH8045> from before me<WH6440>.

Go ye forth<WH3318> from Babylon<WH894>, flee<WH1272> ye from the Chaldeans<WH3778>; with a voice<WH6963> of singing<WH7440> declare<WH5046> ye<WH8085>, tell this<WH3318>, utter it even to the end<WH7097> of the earth<WH776>: say<WH559> ye<WH3068>, Jehovah hath redeemed<WH1350> his servant<WH5650> Jacob<WH3290>.

And they thirsted<WH6770> not when he led<WH3212> them through the deserts<WH2723>; he caused the waters<WH4325> to flow<WH5140> out of the rock<WH6697> for them<WH1234>; he clave the rock<WH6697> also<WH4325>, and the waters gushed out<WH2100>.
There is no peace<WH7965>, saith<WH559> Jehovah<WH3068>, to the wicked<WH7563>.
